model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I've been really focusing on studying algebra lately.
Why is that?
I want to be smart and I think algebra can help me think more logically and critically.
That's a good goal to have. Have you noticed any improvements in your thinking since studying algebra?
Definitely. I feel like I'm able to break down problems and analyze them more effectively.
It's always rewarding when hard work pays off.
Yes it is. It reminds me of when I proved my brother wrong in that race. I was so determined to win and it paid off in the end.
It's great to see that determination and hard work lead to success in different areas of life.
And even when I felt that pain in my arm, I waited and it eventually went away.
It's important to listen to your body and take care of yourself.
Exactly. And sometimes, it's nice to just take a break and enjoy a quiet moment to yourself.
Like when you were admiring the patterns in the ceiling?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Reflecting on past events', 'Related Summaries': 'Classmates A remembers past instances of competitiveness and seeking support from friends.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Classmates A: You know, speaking of feeling freaked out, I remember when I was determined to beat my brother in a race.  ### Classmates B: Oh yeah, I remember that. You did end up winning, right? ### Classmates A: Yep, I left him in the dust. I hate to admit it, but I got a little competitive. ### Classmates B: It's okay, everyone gets like that sometimes.  ### Classmates A: That's true. And do you remember when I had to talk to Tyler about something that was on my mind? ### Classmates B: Yeah, I do. You never told me what that was about.  ### Classmates A: It was just a personal issue that I needed to work through. Tyler was really helpful actually, I'm glad I talked to him. ### Classmates B: It's always good to have someone to talk to about personal stuff like that.  ### Classmates A: Definitely. And hey, thanks for being there for me now. It's nice to know I have a friend who cares. ### Classmates B: Of course, anytime. That's what friends are for. ' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Relaxation and self-care', 'Related Summaries': 'Classmates A and B talk about the importance of relaxation, self-care, and listening to one's body.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Classmates A:  Ah, this is the life. Just taking a moment to relax and appreciate the small things. ### Classmates B:  Yeah, it's nice to just unwind once in a while. What's on your mind? ### Classmates A:  Nothing particular, just enjoying the moment. It's been a hectic week with work and everything. ### Classmates B:  I know what you mean. Sometimes it feels like there's no time to take a break. ### Classmates A:  Yeah, but it's important to prioritize self-care and relaxation. ### Classmates B:  Definitely. Speaking of self-care, how's your arm feeling? Did you end up going to the hospital? ### Classmates A:  Oh, my arm! It ended up just being a muscle strain, so I didn't go to the hospital. But it reminded me to listen to my body and take care of myself. ### Classmates B:  That's good. It's important to know when to seek medical attention, but also to trust your instincts.' }
```
